newsitem.title: UK: NWE oil products mixed - gasoil, gasoline gain.
newsitem.headline: NWE oil products mixed - gasoil, gasoline gain.

text.p: NWE oil products were mixed on Tuesday with gas oil and gasoline gainers and high sulphur fuel steady to lower, traders said.

Gas oil firmed $1 a tonne in very slow trade in line with September IPE which was at $170.50 at 1135 GMT. A cargo of EN590 was rumoured done at $4.75 over September IPE cif NWE but no details were available. Barges were inactive and spreads stable.
Gasoline barges were talked $1 higher in thin trading as a single early deal was heard at $227, Rotterdam refinery material was later bid and offered at $226 and $228 respectively.
Naphtha began quiet with September swaps moving up by $1 to around $186, dealers said.

High sulphur fuel oil barges fell to trade at $93 fob with a trader selling storage material at that number while low sulphur barges traded strong for promptish delivery, fetching $101 fob a tonne for 500 tonnes.
Russian high sulphur cracked fuel was steady at two means +$2 and straight-run was unchanged also with three cargoes of E-4 on offer at three means flat.
